alert.note: Alert for Burnett; Price; Sawyer; Washburn (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Duluth (Northeast Minnesota and Northern Wisconsin)
info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued February 20 at 10:33PM CST until February 23 at 6:00PM CST by NWS Duluth
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM TUESDAY EVENING THROUGH THURSDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Heavy snow and blowing snow possible. Total snow accumulations of 6 to 12 inches possible in most northern Minnesota areas and 11 to 17 inches in northwest Wisconsin and Pine County Minnesota areas. Wind gusts as high as 40 mph. * WHERE...In Minnesota, South Cass, Crow Wing, Northern Aitkin, South Aitkin and Pine Counties. In Wisconsin, Burnett, Washburn, Sawyer and Price Counties. This includes the Tribal Lands of the Lac Courte Oreilles Reservation and the Mille Lacs Band, Lena Lake, East Lake, Hinckley and, Big Sandy Lake areas. * WHEN...From Tuesday evening through Thursday afternoon. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. Widespread blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. The cold wind chills as low as 25 below zero could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 30 minutes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Forecast snow amounts Tuesday evening through Thursday night will change. Keep up with the latest forecast and adjust travel plans accordingly.
info.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.
